name: Dad's Orange Cardamom Breakfast Rolls
author: John Courtenay
summary: Very low fat breakfast rolls with fresh orange, dried cranberries, honey, and cardamom.  I really like these rolls any time of day. Good plain or with an orange glaze.
directions: Zest the orange; set zest aside
Peal and seed orange; cut orange fruit into chunks
Combine zest and fruit in a blender and puree
Pour orange pulp into bread machine pan
Add honey, oil, white flour, wheat flour, salt, and yeast to the orange pulp
Select dough setting, and start the bread machine
Adjust consistency with orange juice or flour as needed to achieve a soft pliable dough
When dough cycle is complete divide dough into 2 or 3 pieces
Roll out to a thickness of 1/4 inch
Sprinkle with brown sugar, cardamom, and dried cranberries
Roll up dough with goodies inside, and slice 1 to 2 inches thick
Place rolls in a baking pan coated with non-stick spray
Allow enough room between the rolls so that they rise properly
Let rise in a warm spot for approximately 1 hour
Bake in a preheated 375 degrees F (190 degrees C) oven for 20 to 25 minutes
Remove from pan, and place on wire rack
